text:
We are running some JUnit tests.  We are also using the JUnitReport task to 
generate an xml based html page.  If we place a System.out.println inside a 
testXXX() method, it doesn't get parsed by the XMLJUnitResultFormatter and 
hence it cannot be rendered inside the html page report.  This is important if 
one needs to print a short description of each testcase and what was actually 
done.

Thanks!
creator: jtmolecule@hotmail.com
sbailliez@apache.org
text:
I don't get it. AFAIK the output is captured by the formatters and for the xml 
one the content is stored in the element named 'system-err' and 'system-out' 
in a CDATA section.

nb: FWIW I don't think it is good practice to output the description of the 
test...just make your method testXXXX meaningful. Plus the output can hardly 
be associated to a test anyway. IMHO output of tests should be 'zero'. 
Absolutely no one will read the output of hundred or thousands of tests.

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
actually sometimes it is useful to parse the results of failed tests.

example, httpunit tests expects to get something like 'happy' in the response of
a URL, but instead it gets some other text string back. My httpunit test code
prints out the entire response for diagnostics, so that I can see what the
server sent back...

A meaninful test name is important, but not enough. 

IMO this should be downgraded to enhancement, the enhancement being changes to
the XSLT file to include the output results.

creator: sbailliez@apache.org
text:
Ok, did not get that bug report was related to the xsl not using the output 
for the html report, there was a talk about parsing, formatter etc that has 
not much to do to me with the problem.

That said I'm partly convinced...the failed test just tell you that it 
failed... you should not need some print..this is what the debugger is for. :)

It's also that in the current state all you can do is to add a page with the 
output of all tests...you will barely be able to associate it to a given 
testcase unless you add some print here and there in the test methods...

Changing the summary to something more meaningful to me.

I'm the original submitter.  We are writing junit tests to perform some 
testcases, and if it's successful, it would be more informative to know which 
successful test cases were performed, rather than just seeing the 
word "success" on the html page.  That way, there can be an audit on which 
tests were performed without looking at the code.  At least with the fail
(String) and assertEquals(String, *, *), we can print something out to say what 
failed, but if it's successful, there is no trail on which ones became 
successful.

The std-out and std-err is for the whole page and not for individual testXXX 
methods.  Besides, I tried have a System.out.println() statement, and nothing 
showed up on the html page.

Thanks for your feedbacks.
creator: jtmolecule@hotmail.com

text:
Nothing showed up on the report because the information is not used by the xsl.
However you can customize the stylesheet so that it does it.
creator: sbailliez@apache.org

text: Closing this bug; stdout and stderr are displayed in junit reports now.
creator: stevel@apache.org
